txt.en: You are too far from the mistrustful dwarf...
'I see. Perhaps I'll have to hear more from them....'
You are too far from the mistrustful dwarf...
'What do we owe them? They are not the only dwarves to have lost a home!'
You are too far from the mistrustful dwarf...
'You are known to us, and I trust your words in this matter.'
You have spoken to the mistrustful Dwarves of Erebor on behalf of the Stout-axes and King Thorin III.
'I shall give these Stout-axes a chance, even if I think they are a bit thin-bearded!'
Completed

While you are not certain that you have changed the minds of all of the dwarves, you have done well to ease tensions between Durin's Folk and the Stout-axes.\n\nIt is King Thorin's will that the Stout-axes be welcome among Durin's Folk, and whether it is this day or another, they shall come to unite in friendship.
'Yes?'
'Yes?'
'Yes?'
'Yes?'
You are too far from the mistrustful dwarf...

'I have thought much on Ambassador Spakorth's words....

'These Stout-axes have fled oppression and devastation, and now I hear there are dwarves in Erebor who would sooner spit on them than welcome them as friends. This is not the way of Durin's Folk. The Stout-axes are our kin, whether they believe it so or not, and they must be treated as such.

'You and Gimli know well what the Stout-axes have suffered, and you know their minds as none among us do. Speak to the mistrustful few among us, and reassure them that the Stout-axes come to us as refugees and friends.'
King Thorin III wishes to unite the Dwarves of Durin's Folk and the Stout-axes in friendship.
Talked to mistrustful dwarves on behalf of the Stout-axes ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
<rgb=#FF00FF>Talk</rgb> to mistrustful dwarves on behalf of the Stout-axes ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Forging Trust

Mistrustful dwarves can be found in the Hall Under the Mountain and outside Erebor.\n\nAfter learning that several dwarves are having misgivings about welcoming the Stout-axes into Erebor, King Thorin III has asked you to speak to mistrustful dwarves on the Stout-axes' behalf.
